description.p: The best interfaces are the ones you barely notice. Symphony’s back end is all about workflow, dispensing with the proverbial bells and whistles and focusing on helping you complete the task at hand.

From the inside out, Symphony is rooted in the very same principles that you adhere to in your own work. Openness. Standards compliance. Flexibility. Symphony doesn’t just help you get the job done, it helps you get the job done right.

Symphony doesn’t tell you what kind of content to manage, or how. It doesn’t lock you into a rigid structure or dictate some silly URL schema. It just gives you the tools and stays out of your way. Trust us, you’ll like it.

Leveraging the full power of XSLT, Symphony gives you what few other templating systems can: the ability to publish in nearly any format, to control every single character you output, and to maintain a complete separation between content and presentation.
The best interfaces are the ones you barely notice. Symphony’s back end is all about workflow, dispensing with the proverbial bells and whistles and focusing on helping you complete the task at hand.

We love Symphony. And when you love something, you take care of it. Whether it’s the core team improving the system or writing documentation, or community members building extensions and helping newbies on the forum, the people here are generous, industrious, and quite often brilliant. You’ll be glad you joined us.

The clean, almost minimal design of Symphony’s admin interface keeps the focus on your work, not ours. Layouts and interactions are kept straightforward and consistent. Easy to learn and easy to use, the UI becomes second nature in no time at all.

Click on a row to select it. Drag and drop to easily reorder your pages. Add and reorder fields in place while modeling your content types. Symphony’s admin interface aims to make even the simplest tasks a little bit simpler.

Work more efficiently by managing multiple entries, sections, pages, or extensions right from the index view. Quickly change your entries’ checkbox states or select values, install and uninstall extensions, and even delete items.

Symphony puts an entire suite of tools at your fingertips for debugging front-end pages. Check source code (from XML to XSLT to output), dynamically test XPath selectors, review build and load statistics. You’ll wonder how you ever developed a website without it.
Symphony’s admin interface employs the widely-used jQuery library, making it a cinch for developers to customize and extend.

caption.p: Symphony's interface is simple and elegant.
Symphony's bulk editing features will save you time.
Symphony gives you a powerful front-end debugging interface.
